document: Software Evolution and Maintenance: Chapter 6 - Impact Analysis

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of impact analysis in the maintenance process?
options: To rewrite the entire source code
To identify components impacted by a Change Request (CR)
To eliminate the need for regression testing
questions.answer: To identify components impacted by a Change Request (CR)

questions.question: Which of the following is a reason for performing impact analysis?
options: To estimate the cost of executing the change request
To avoid recording history of changes
To ensure no regression testing is performed
To decrease the transparency of software structure
questions.answer: To estimate the cost of executing the change request

questions.question: What is defined as the ability to describe and follow the life of an artifact in both forward and backward directions?
What is 'external traceability' in the context of software artifacts?
options: Tracing dependent artifacts within the same model

questions.question: What does the term 'Starting Impact Set (SIS)' refer to?
options: The set of objects actually changed after implementation
The initial set of objects presumed to be impacted by a CR
The set of objects that were incorrectly identified as impacted
The set of objects discovered during coding
questions.answer: The initial set of objects presumed to be impacted by a CR

questions.question: Which impact set contains objects estimated to be impacted according to a specific analysis approach?
The 'Actual Impact Set (AIS)' is defined as:
options: The set of objects estimated by the tool
The set of objects actually changed as a result of performing a CR
The set of objects that remained unchanged
The initial set identified from documentation
questions.answer: The set of objects actually changed as a result of performing a CR

questions.question: What is the 'Discovered Impact Set (DIS)'?
options: New impacted objects found during implementation not contained in CIS
Objects identified during the initial analysis of the CR
Objects that were removed from the project
The final set of all code artifacts
questions.answer: New impacted objects found during implementation not contained in CIS

questions.question: How is the False Positive Impact Set (FPIS) mathematically represented?
In the impact analysis process, what is the goal regarding AIS and CIS?
options: Maximize the difference between AIS and CIS
Minimize the difference by eliminating false positives and identifying true impacts
Ensure CIS is always larger than AIS
questions.answer: Minimize the difference by eliminating false positives and identifying true impacts

questions.question: Which metric represents the fraction of actual impacts contained in the Candidate Impact Set (CIS)?
The value of recall is 1 when:
Which metric represents the fraction of candidate impacts that are actually impacted?
What is the value of precision if the False Positive Impact Set (FPIS) is empty?
What does 'Adequacy' of an impact analysis approach refer to?
options: The ability to identify all affected elements to be modified
The ability to generate a call graph
questions.answer: The ability to identify all affected elements to be modified

questions.question: In the context of adequacy, 'Inclusiveness' is 1 if:
options: AIS is a subset of CIS
questions.answer: AIS is a subset of CIS

questions.question: The ability of an approach to avoid including unnecessary objects in the CIS is known as:
What is 'Adherence' in impact analysis?
options: The ability to produce a CIS as close to AIS as possible
The ability to follow coding standards
The relationship between requirements and tests
The number of changes per month
questions.answer: The ability to produce a CIS as close to AIS as possible

questions.question: Why is it difficult to fully automate the identification of the SIS (concept assignment problem)?
options: Because computers cannot read source code
Because programs and concepts occur at different levels of abstraction
Because traceability graphs are always horizontal
questions.answer: Because programs and concepts occur at different levels of abstraction

questions.question: According to the traceability graph, which artifacts can be linked to show the relationships among work products?
options: Requirements, Design, Code, and Test scenarios
Only Source Code and Call Graphs
questions.answer: Requirements, Design, Code, and Test scenarios
